<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 231, 294]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 302, 361, 318]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Non-calculator (Extended)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 302, 905, 315]]<|/det|>
 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[825, 326, 905, 342]]<|/det|>
2 hours

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 399, 372]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 402, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 225, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 433, 294, 450]]<|/det|>
- Answer all questions. - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 808, 479]]<|/det|>
- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. - Write your answer to each question in the space provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 495, 482, 510]]<|/det|>
- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. - Do not write on any bar codes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 525, 451, 542]]<|/det|>
- Calculators must not be used in this paper. - You may use tracing paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 556, 468, 573]]<|/det|>
- You must show all necessary working clearly.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 601, 217, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION - The total mark for this paper is 100.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ] .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 121, 367, 138]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of triangle, base \(b\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 115, 682, 146]]<|/det|>
\[
A=\frac{1}{2} b h
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 166, 672, 184]]<|/det|>
\[
A=\pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 170, 308, 186]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of circle of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 219, 385, 235]]<|/det|>
Circumference, \(C\), of circle of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 219, 672, 233]]<|/det|>
\[
C=2 \pi r
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 267, 515, 284]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 265, 686, 281]]<|/det|>
\[
A=2 \pi r h
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 314, 537, 331]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 314, 672, 330]]<|/det|>
\[
A=\pi r l
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 361, 373, 378]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 359, 682, 377]]<|/det|>
\[
A=4 \pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 410, 490, 426]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of prism, cross-sectional area \(A\), length \(l\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 408, 664, 426]]<|/det|>
\[
V=A l
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 456, 435, 474]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 449, 682, 481]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} A h
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 505, 421, 524]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 503, 680, 521]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\pi r^{2} h
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 552, 396, 571]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cone of radius \(r\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 546, 690, 575]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} \pi r^{2} h
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 603, 338, 620]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 595, 686, 626]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 645, 772, 672]]<|/det|>
\(x=\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 734, 777, 826]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{a}{\sin A}=\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
& a^{2}=b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
& \text { Area }=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin C
\end{aligned}
\]
